Key Arguments: The legislation represents opinion policing and infringes on democratic principles.
Misinformation and disinformation definitions are subjective and difficult to prove.
The government is undermining citizens' ability to discern truth due to a lack of trust in the education system.
The proposed powers for ACMA would lead to increased surveillance and censorship.
Instant messaging should not be included in the framework as it infringes on personal privacy.
Professional news and other content should not be exempt from the legislation.
Notable Quotes: Spying on the citizens of Australia is NOT part of ANY Democratic process.
This Act is the very beginning of dystopia.
How can we, and why must we, trust unelected bureaucrats to determine what determines misinformation and disinformation?
The depression that will occur in Australian citizenry whose freedom of expression is denied to them will be found to be unhealthy.
